summary: The concept of "economic cooperation between developing countries," also known as "South-South cooperation," is pivotal in the EU's cooperation policy framework. This approach emphasizes collaborative economic initiatives among developing nations, fostering mutual support and shared development goals. The EU recognizes South-South cooperation as a strategic mechanism to enhance sustainable development, promote trade, and strengthen regional integration. By redirecting focus towards this term, the EU aims to facilitate legal and regulatory frameworks that support such partnerships, ensuring that developing countries can leverage their collective strengths to address common challenges and achieve economic resilience.
